rukus.text: No indeed! By the moon
and the night when it drew back
and polished is the morning
Truly, it is one of the greatest of all things
as a warner to the mortals
to whomever willed among you that he go forward or remain behind
Every soul is a pledge for what it earned
but the Companions of the Right
will be in Gardens and will demand of one another
about the ones who sin
What thrust you into Saqar
They would say: We be not among the ones who formally pray
and we were not those who feed the needy
And we had been ones who engage in idle talk along with the ones who engage in idle talk
And we had been denying the Day of Judgment
until the certainty of the Hour approached us
Then, intercession will not profit them from the ones who are intercessors
Then, what is the matter with them that they are ones who turn aside from the admonition
as though they had been frightened donkeys
that ran away from a lion
Nay! Every man among them wants to be given unrolled scrolls
No indeed! Nay! They fear not the world to come
No indeed! Truly, it is an admonition
So let whoever willed, remember it
But they will not remember unless God wills. He is Worthy of God-consciousness and He is Worthy of granting The Forgiveness
